taskDescription: Describe how Escher achieved this tessellation (Figure 10.XX).
detailedSolution: Escher used two figures, a bird and a donkey. He did a row of birds flying in one direction. Then, in the second row he fit in a row of donkeys moving in the same direction. Row 3 is a reflection of the first row, the birds flying in the opposite direction. Row 4 is a reflection of the row 2, the donkeys moving in the opposite direction of row 2, but the same direction as the birds in row 3.
